For anyone interested, there are several ballot initiatives pertaining to abortion-related issues going on in this election. The states carrying out these votes are California, Colorado, South Dakota, and Michigan (stem cell-related). There hasn't really been much reporting about it since the presidential election has been dominating the news.
 
 These ballot initiative votes can be monitored at Local Ballot Measures - Election Center 2008 - Elections & Politics from CNN.com
Actually, the one I find the most interesting is that 73% in Colorado voted AGAINST an amendment stating that life begins at conception.

Actually, the one I find the most interesting is that 73% in Colorado voted AGAINST an amendment stating that life begins at conception.

 
 I am also looking at the stem cell research initiative in Mass. There was an article recently about a paralyzed ex-cop who went to China for an operation that put stem cells in his broken neck, and he got back his ability to move his arms.. and a little bit of his legs rather than be paralyzed from the neck down.
 
 Texas Cop Saved By Stem Cells - AOL Video
 
 
 I think we should not loose our medical and technological edge because of superstition.

I think we should not loose our medical and technological edge because of superstition.

 
 It's an ethics issue, not just a religious one. Technological edge isn't worth throwing ethics and standards out the window and using for experimental purposes what will become a person if left to grow and develop. We could get a "medical and technological edge" by taking people off the street and experimenting on them too, but that doesn't mean we should do it.
